page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY 4
page.content:
{THE WORKHOUSE: { }Designed by{Gilbert Scott}and built in{1836}to hold up to{208}people. It only ever averaged up to{80}people though, at a cost of{14p}each per week. The workhouse was closed in 1931 and is now owned by Northamptonshire County Council.
{THE CHANTRY HOUSE:} This was originally the{Grammar {School}and was founded as part of the Archdeacon's will. Until{1866}it was the school and master's residence, but then it was sold and most of it rebuilt.
{MILL:}This was recorded in the original Doomsday book, but was badly damaged by{fire in 1911.
